cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Table Service
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

attacks.name: Punch and Run
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Morelull
cards.text: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they're dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.

attacks.name: Sleep Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Charizard
cards.text: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Security Guard
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

attacks.name: Panic
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.

attacks.name: Hold Still
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Greninja

abilities.name: Evasion Jutsu
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

cards.text: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

attacks.name: Furious Shurikens
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Detective Pikachu
cards.text: He loves to show off his vast knowledge. This expressive Pikachu is like a middle-aged man.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Pantomime
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch 1 of your face-down Prize cards with the top card of your deck.

cards.text: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: This Pokémon was created by years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

attacks.name: Psyjack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Burn
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Machamp
cards.text: It grasps its opponents with its four arms and twists them up in an intricate hold. People call it "the Machamp special."

attacks.name: Directing Traffic
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.

attacks.name: Healing Melody
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: It grows close to others easily and is also easily spoiled. The disparity between its face and its actions makes many young people wild about it.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

attacks.name: Continuous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Ditto
cards.text: While it can transform into anything, each Ditto apparently has its own strengths and weaknesses when it comes to transformations.

attacks.name: Copy Anything
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack. If this Pokémon doesn't have the necessary Energy to use that attack, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Slaking
cards.text: The world's laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there's no food left within its reach.

attacks.name: Pitch
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
